Class StageController

java.lang.Object
com.lucas.ticketsalesmanager.views.controllers.StageController
public class StageController extends Object
Controller class for managing the main stage (window) of the application. This class provides methods to change the content of the stage, show alerts, and close the stage.

It handles actions related to the primary window, such as updating the scene and showing different types of alerts to the user. The controller is designed to be used within the context of a JavaFX application with a main window represented by a Stage.

  • Constructor Details

    • StageController

      public StageController(javafx.stage.Stage mainStage)
      Constructs a new StageController with the specified main stage. The stage is configured to be resizable, centered on the screen, and given a default title.
      Parameters:
      mainStage - the primary stage (window) of the application

  • Method Details

    • changeStageContent

      public void changeStageContent(javafx.scene.Parent content)
      Changes the content of the main stage by setting a new scene. The scene will be centered on the screen and displayed.
      Parameters:
      content - the new content (FXML) to set on the stage
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided content is null

    • showAlert

      public void showAlert(javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType type, String title, String message)
      Displays an alert to the user with a given type, title, and message. The alert is shown asynchronously on the JavaFX application thread.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of alert (e.g., INFORMATION, ERROR, WARNING)
      title - the title of the alert
      message - the message to display in the alert

    • closeStage

      public void closeStage()
      Closes the main stage and exits the application. This method is typically called when the application is being terminated.
